item.text: When the enemies of Judah and Benjamin learned that the former exiles were building a temple for the Lord God of Israel,

they <st data-num="05066" class="">came</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="02216" class="">Zerubbabel</st> and the <st data-num="07218 01">leaders</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to <st data-num="01992" class="">them</st>, “Let us <st data-num="05973" class="">help</st> you <st data-num="01129" class="">build</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> like you we <st data-num="01875" class="">seek</st> your <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> and <st data-num="0587" class="">we</st> have been <st data-num="02076" class="">sacrificing</st> to him<n id="3" /> from the <st data-num="03117" class="">time</st><n id="4" /> of <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="0634" class="">Esarhaddon</st><n id="5" /> of <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st>, who <st data-num="05927" class="">brought</st> us <st data-num="06311" class="">here</st>.”<n id="6" />

But Zerubbabel, Jeshua, and the rest of the leaders of Israel said to them, “You have no right to help us build the temple of our God. We will build it by ourselves for the Lord God of Israel, just as King Cyrus, the king of Persia, has commanded us.”

<st data-num="01961" class="">Then</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">local</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st><n id="1" /> began to <st data-num="07503 03027">discourage</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> and to <st data-num="01086" class="">dishearten</st> them from <st data-num="01129" class="">building</st>.
They were hiring advisers to oppose them, so as to frustrate their plans, throughout the time of King Cyrus of Persia until the reign of King Darius of Persia.
At the beginning of the reign of Ahasuerus they filed an accusation against the inhabitants of Judah and Jerusalem.

And during the reign of Artaxerxes, Bishlam, Mithredath, Tabeel, and the rest of their colleagues wrote to King Artaxerxes of Persia. This letter was first written in Aramaic but then translated.

[What follows is in Aramaic.]
Rehum the commander and Shimshai the scribe wrote a letter concerning Jerusalem to King Artaxerxes as follows:

<st data-num="0116" class="">From</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="07348" class="">Rehum</st> the <st data-num="01169 02942">commander</st>, <st data-num="08124" class="">Shimshai</st> the <st data-num="05613" class="">scribe</st>, and the <st data-num="07606" class="">rest</st> of their <st data-num="03675" class="">colleagues</st>—the <st data-num="01784" class="">judges</st>, the <st data-num="0671" class="">rulers</st>, the <st data-num="02967" class="">officials</st>, the <st data-num="0670" class="">secretaries</st>, the <st data-num="0756" class="">Erechites</st>, the <st data-num="0896" class="">Babylonians</st>, the <st data-num="07801" class="">people of Susa</st> (<st data-num="01768" class="">that is</st>,<n id="2" /> the <st data-num="05962" class="">Elamites</st>),

and the <st data-num="07606" class="">rest</st> of the <st data-num="0524" class="">nations</st> <st data-num="01768 01994">whom</st> the <st data-num="07229" class="">great</st> and <st data-num="03358" class="">noble</st> <st data-num="0620" class="">Ashurbanipal</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01541" class="">deported</st> and <st data-num="03488" class="">settled</st> in the <st data-num="07149" class="">cities</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="01768" class="">of</st> <st data-num="08115" class="">Samaria</st> and <st data-num="07606" class="">other places</st> in <st data-num="05675" class="">Trans</st>-<st data-num="05103" class="">Euphrates</st>.<n id="3" />

(This is a copy of the letter they sent to him.)

“To King Artaxerxes, from your servants in Trans-Euphrates:

<st data-num="03706" class="">Now</st><n id="1" /> let the <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st> <st data-num="01934" class="">be</st> <st data-num="03046" class="">aware</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">that</st> the <st data-num="03062" class="">Jews</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">who</st> <st data-num="05559" class="">came up</st> <st data-num="05922" class="">to</st> us <st data-num="04481 03890">from</st> you have <st data-num="0858" class="">gone</st> to <st data-num="03390" class="">Jerusalem</st>. They are <st data-num="01124" class="">rebuilding</st> that <st data-num="04779" class="">rebellious</st> and <st data-num="0873" class="">odious</st> <st data-num="07149" class="">city</st>.<n id="2" /> They are <st data-num="03635" class="">completing</st> its <st data-num="07792" class="">walls</st> and <st data-num="02338" class="">repairing</st> its <st data-num="0787" class="">foundations</st>.

Let the <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st> <st data-num="03705" class="">also</st> <st data-num="01934" class="">be</st> <st data-num="03046" class="">aware</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">that</st> <st data-num="02006" class="">if</st> <st data-num="01791" class="">this</st> <st data-num="07149" class="">city</st> is <st data-num="01124" class="">built</st> and its <st data-num="07792" class="">walls</st> are <st data-num="03635" class="">completed</st>, <st data-num="03809" class="">no</st> more <st data-num="04061" class="">tax</st>, <st data-num="01093" class="">custom</st>, or <st data-num="01983" class="">toll</st> will be <st data-num="05415" class="">paid</st>, and the <st data-num="04430" class="">royal</st> <st data-num="0674" class="">treasury</st><n id="1" /> will <st data-num="05142" class="">suffer loss</st>.

<st data-num="03705 03606 06903">In light of the fact</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">that</st> we <st data-num="04416 01965 04415">are loyal to the king</st>,<n id="1" /> and since it does <st data-num="03809" class="">not</st> <st data-num="02370" class="">seem</st> <st data-num="0749" class="">appropriate</st> to us that the <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st> should <st data-num="06173" class="">sustain damage</st>,<n id="2" /> we are <st data-num="07972" class="">sending</st> the <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st> <st data-num="05922 01836">this</st> <st data-num="03046" class="">information</st><n id="3" />

<st data-num="01768" class="">so that</st> he may <st data-num="01240" class="">initiate a search</st> of the <st data-num="05609 01799">records</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01768" class="">of</st> his <st data-num="02" class="">predecessors</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="07912 03046">discover</st> in those <st data-num="05609 01799">records</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="01768" class="">that</st> <st data-num="01791" class="">this</st> <st data-num="07149" class="">city</st> is <st data-num="07149 04779">rebellious</st><n id="4" /> and <st data-num="05142" class="">injurious</st> to both <st data-num="04430" class="">kings</st> and <st data-num="04083" class="">provinces</st>, <st data-num="05648" class="">producing</st> <st data-num="01459" class="">internal</st> <st data-num="0849" class="">revolts</st><n id="5" /> <st data-num="04481" class="">from</st> <st data-num="05957" class="">long</st> <st data-num="03118" class="">ago</st>.<n id="6" /> It is <st data-num="05922" class="">for</st> <st data-num="01836" class="">this very reason</st> that <st data-num="01791" class="">this</st> <st data-num="07149" class="">city</st> was <st data-num="02718" class="">destroyed</st>.
We therefore are informing the king that if this city is rebuilt and its walls are completed, you will not retain control of this portion of Trans-Euphrates.”

The king sent the following response:

“To Rehum the commander, Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their colleagues who live in Samaria and other parts of Trans-Euphrates: Greetings!

The <st data-num="05407 01768">letter</st> you <st data-num="07972" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="05922" class="">to</st> us has been <st data-num="06568" class="">translated</st> and <st data-num="07123" class="">read</st> <st data-num="06925" class="">in</st> my <st data-num="06925" class="">presence</st>.

So I <st data-num="04481 07761">gave</st> <st data-num="02942" class="">orders</st>,<n id="1" /> and it was <st data-num="01240 07912">determined</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="01768" class="">that</st> <st data-num="01791" class="">this</st> <st data-num="07149" class="">city</st> <st data-num="04481" class="">from</st> <st data-num="05957" class="">long</st> <st data-num="03118" class="">ago</st> has been <st data-num="05376" class="">engaging in insurrection</st> <st data-num="05922" class="">against</st> <st data-num="04430" class="">kings</st>. It has continually <st data-num="05648" class="">engaged in</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="04776" class="">rebellion</st> and <st data-num="0849" class="">revolt</st>.

<st data-num="08624" class="">Powerful</st> <st data-num="04430" class="">kings</st> have <st data-num="01934" class="">been</st> <st data-num="05922" class="">over</st> <st data-num="03390" class="">Jerusalem</st> who <st data-num="07990" class="">ruled</st> throughout the <st data-num="03606" class="">entire</st> <st data-num="05675" class="">Trans</st>-<st data-num="05103" class="">Euphrates</st><n id="1" /> and who were the <st data-num="03052" class="">beneficiaries</st> of<n id="2" /> <st data-num="04061" class="">tribute</st>, <st data-num="01093" class="">custom</st>, and <st data-num="01983" class="">toll</st>.

<st data-num="03705" class="">Now</st> <st data-num="07761" class="">give</st> <st data-num="02942" class="">orders</st> that <st data-num="0479" class="">these</st> <st data-num="01400" class="">men</st> <st data-num="0989" class="">cease</st> their work and that <st data-num="01791" class="">this</st> <st data-num="07149" class="">city</st> <st data-num="03809" class="">not</st> be <st data-num="01124" class="">rebuilt</st> <st data-num="05705" class="">until</st> such time as I so <st data-num="04481 02941 07761">instruct</st>.<n id="1" />
Exercise appropriate caution so that there is no negligence in this matter. Why should danger increase to the point that the king sustains damage?”

Then, as soon as the copy of the letter from King Artaxerxes was read in the presence of Rehum, Shimshai the scribe, and their colleagues, they proceeded promptly to the Jews in Jerusalem and stopped them with threat of armed force.
So the work on the temple of God in Jerusalem came to a halt. It remained halted until the second year of the reign of King Darius of Persia.
